originalText.text: The review was for THE HARLEM TAVERN not the TAFT HOUSES Houses.... I found it fun for a night's out.  My gurl and I had a good time the atmosphere was great, fish tacos and fish and chips was on point, music was ok, drinks was nice.  The only issue I had was while we was eating people came to visit another table with a big dog.  The waitress was notified and we was moved to another table.  The night was going great until that happened.  I would have gave Harlem Tarven a 4* or even a 5.  Maybe next time.

originalText.text: the elevator has piss in it and sometimes doesn’t work. the stairs also have sticky stuff a lot of the time but i don’t know what it is. The entrance to the building, the door, is sometimes unlocked and locked and when it’s locked people just yank it open because lots of residents don’t have the key to it(if you wait a while somebody will come out and you can go in) the people are pretty nice overall. i mean i don’t talk to them but they mind their own business and don’t cause any trouble. sometimes people hang outside the entrance because they’re bored, usually old ladies. i see policemen in the entrance of the building sometimes but i haven’t heard of any murders or anything serious like that happening in the building. the room in my place is pretty spacious and life is good once you’re home. i don’t feel paranoid or sad or wanting to live in a different building. it’s alright, and i think it’s cheap too

originalText.text: Maintenance personnel are almost nonexistent but when they are, they do try. Taft management do try when it comes to handling paperwork but thats all I can pretty much say. Place is not an eyesore, but theres a lot of construction going on. Cant complain.

originalText.text: This is a New York City Housing Authority building complex. They sometimes try to keep the place clean. But the staircase has feces and they haven't cleaned it in a week. The tenants do complain. But it's obvious the building management is not checking up on there maintenance workers.

text.text: This is a New York City Housing Authority building complex. They sometimes try to keep the place clean. But the staircase has feces and they haven't cleaned it in a week. The tenants do complain. But it's obvious the building management is not checking up on there maintenance workers.

originalText.text:
My parents were one of the first group of people who moved here back in 1962. And, it was good then. Today in 2020. The complex has become an eyesore that is a representation of the failure of NYCHA to maintain the status and standards of living that all Americans should expect.

A swamp indicative of the morass currently on display in Washington DC.

No cooperation between Management and the needs of the Tenants.

Fraud, Waste and Abuse at it's most blatant example.

Total reorganization at the top on down will be it's only viable solution.
